00062 class SIM_API cDisplayString
00063 {
00064   private:
00065     enum { MAXARGS = 16 };  // maximum number of arguments per tag
00066 
00067     // holds one tag
00068     struct Tag {
00069        char *name;
00070        int numargs;
00071        char *args[MAXARGS];
00072        Tag() {name=NULL; numargs=0;}
00073     };
00074 
00075     char *buffer;       // holds pieces of display string (sliced with zeroes)
00076     char *bufferend;    // points to last byte of buffer allocated
00077     Tag *tags;          // table of tags
00078     int numtags;        // number of tags
00079 
00080     mutable char *dispstr; // cached copy of assembled display string
00081     mutable bool needsassemble; // if dispstr is up-to-date
00082 
00083     // needed for notifications
00084     cComponent *ownercomponent;
00085 
00086   private:
00087     // helper functions
00088     void doParse(const char *s);
00089     void doUpdateWith(const cDisplayString& ds);
00090     bool doSetTagArg(int tagindex, int index, const char *value);
00091     bool doSetTagArg(const char *tagname, int index, const char *value);
00092     int doInsertTag(const char *tagname, int atindex=0);
00093     bool doRemoveTag(int tagindex);
00094 
00095     void doParse();
00096     void assemble() const;
00097     void clearTags();
00098     bool pointsIntoBuffer(char *s) const {return s>=buffer && s<=bufferend;}
00099     static void strcatescaped(char *d, const char *s);
00100 
00101     // internal: called before the stored display string changes
00102     void beforeChange();
00103     // internal: called when the stored display string changes, and notifies Envir in turn.
00104     void afterChange();
00105 
00106   public:
00107     // internal:
00108     void setHostObject(cComponent *o) {ownercomponent=o;}
00109     void dump() const;
00110 
00111   public:
00114 
00118     cDisplayString();
00119 
00123     cDisplayString(const char *dispstr);
00124 
00128     cDisplayString(const cDisplayString& ds);
00129 
00133     ~cDisplayString();
00135 
00141     cDisplayString& operator=(const cDisplayString& ds) {parse(ds.str()); return *this;}
00142 
00146     cDisplayString& operator=(const char *s)  {parse(s); return *this;}
00147 
00151     operator const char *() const  {return str();}
00153 
00156 
00160     const char *str() const;
00161 
00165     void set(const char *displaystr)  {parse(displaystr);}
00166 
00171     void parse(const char *displaystr);
00172 
00177     void updateWith(const cDisplayString& ds);
00178 
00183     void updateWith(const char *s);
00185

00219     bool setTagArg(const char *tagname, int index, const char *value);
00220

00226
